northern-michigan.subtitle: Great Lakes Getaway
northern-michigan.description: Explore Northern Michigan's clear waters, coastal towns, and dense forests. This trip highlights some of the most scenic parts of the Great Lakes region with a focus on simple, memorable experiences.

highlights.name: Dining at Farm Club
highlights.description: Farm Club seamlessly blends farming, dining, and community. Nestled just outside Traverse City, it offers a unique experience where visitors can enjoy fresh, seasonal meals sourced directly from its own farm, sip on house-brewed beer and cider, and shop a thoughtfully curated market.

highlights.name: Cruising on Traverse Bay
highlights.description: Spend time on Grand Traverse Bay with a scenic boat cruise. It's a relaxed way to see the coastline and enjoy the water without getting too hands-on.

highlights.name: Hiking Empire Bluffs
highlights.description: This 1.5-mile out-and-back trail near Sleeping Bear Dunes leads through the woods to an overlook with wide views of Lake Michigan. It's a short, rewarding hike that's easy to fit into the day.

arizona.subtitle: Red Rock Road Trip
arizona.description: Arizona's landscapes are as varied as they are striking — from the vast depths of the Grand Canyon to the towering red rocks of Sedona. This road trip weaves through national parks, desert towns, and wide-open spaces, offering a glimpse into the natural beauty and cultural history of the American Southwest.

highlights.name: Brunch at Indian Gardens Cafe
highlights.description: Indian Gardens Café & Market is a relaxed spot just outside Sedona, offering fresh, seasonal breakfasts and lunches in a historic setting. Guests can grab a coffee or fresh juice, shop local goods in the market, and unwind on the shaded outdoor patio surrounded by trees and canyon views.

highlights.name: Paddling on Lake Powell
highlights.description: Paddle through the stunning waters of Lake Powell, navigating between dramatic red rock formations and hidden coves. Along the way, you can hike Antelope Canyon, exploring its narrow passageways and unique, flowing shapes before continuing your journey on the water.

highlights.name: Hiking Cathedral Rock
highlights.description: This 1.5-mile out-and-back trail near Sedona winds through desert terrain, leading to a stunning viewpoint atop Cathedral Rock. It's a great spot to catch the sunset, with panoramic views of the red rock formations and Verde Valley.

washington.subtitle: Coasts & Cascade Road Trip
washington.description: Washington offers a striking mix of coastal beauty, dense rainforests, and towering mountain ranges. From the rugged coastline of Olympic National Park to the sweeping views of the Northern Cascades, this road trip weaves through diverse landscapes, showcasing the best of the Pacific Northwest.

highlights.name: Dinner at Granny's Café
highlights.description: Granny's Café, a staple since 1956, offers classic comfort food with a local twist. Nestled in the heart of the Olympic National Park, it's the perfect stop after a day of adventure. Known for their hearty, home-cooked meals, they serve up fresh seafood, locally sourced ingredients, and homemade desserts. Don't miss their famous ice cream, made right in-house and served in a variety of flavors that change with the seasons.

highlights.name: Sailing the San Juan Islands
highlights.description: Set sail through the waters of the San Juan Islands, navigating between islands and rocky shores. This peaceful sailing adventure offers stunning views of the coastline and the chance to spot local wildlife, including seals, otters, and even orcas in the distance.

highlights.name: Hiking Cascade Pass
highlights.description: Cascade Pass is a 7.4-mile round-trip trail in North Cascades National Park, known for its stunning beauty and diverse wildlife. It's not the easiest trail, but the effort is worth it for the breathtaking views of peaks, snow-capped mountains, and meadows. You'll likely encounter snow and, if you're lucky, spot wildlife such as marmots and mountain goats along the way. It's one of the most beautiful hikes in Washington.

smoky-mountains.subtitle: Appalachian Adventure
smoky-mountains.description: The Great Smoky Mountains National Park offers a mix of diverse landscapes, wildlife, and striking fall colors. This road trip will take you through dense forests, past mountain peaks, and into some of the best views of the Smokies.

highlights.name: Dinner at The Woodshed
highlights.description: The Woodshed in Gatlinburg is a reliable stop after a day outdoors. Known for its woodsy, casual setting and authentic Southern comfort food, the restaurant serves everything from smoked meats to onion rings, along with homemade sides. It's a great spot to relax and enjoy a hearty meal, especially after a full day of exploring.

highlights.name: Fall Foliage Viewing on Newfound Gap Road
highlights.description: Newfound Gap Road offers one of the best ways to see the Smokies' fall colors. The drive through the park takes you from lower elevations up to higher ridges, with each step bringing more views. The ride provides plenty of opportunities to stop and take in the colors, especially as the leaves start to change in the fall.

highlights.name: Hiking Chimney Tops Trail
highlights.description: The Chimney Tops Trail is a 4-mile round-trip hike that leads to one of the best views in the park. The trail climbs steadily through thick forests and rocky sections, rewarding you with panoramic views from the top. It's a strenuous hike, but the effort is worth it, especially with the fall foliage in full display along the route and from the summit.

southern-california.subtitle: Coastline Cruise
southern-california.description: Southern California offers a mix of coastlines, desert landscapes, and vibrant cities — all within a few hours of each other. This road trip takes you from rugged beaches to palm-lined streets, across national parks and up into mountain towns, showing the full range of what SoCal has to offer beyond just the postcards.

highlights.name: Dinner at Brockton Villa Restaurant
highlights.description: Brockton Villa is set inside one of La Jolla's original beach cottages, built in 1894 and rich with local history. Once a private retreat and later a quirky residence, the building was carefully restored into a restaurant in the early '90s. Today, it serves fresh coastal food with front-row views of La Jolla Cove. Known for their signature "Coast Toast" and seafood dishes, it's the perfect spot to unwind after a day in the sun. The setting is casual but historic, and the outdoor patio is one of the best places in town to catch sunset over the water.

highlights.name: Exploring Balboa Park
highlights.description: Balboa Park is the cultural heart of San Diego — a huge urban park packed with museums, gardens, trails, and historic architecture. Spend a day wandering through Spanish Colonial Revival buildings, checking out art exhibits, or relaxing under the massive fig trees. Whether you're into history, science, or just looking for a laid-back afternoon, it's easy to spend a full day here without running out of things to see.

highlights.name: Hiking Ryan Mountain in Joshua Tree
highlights.description: Ryan Mountain is a 3-mile out-and-back hike that delivers some of the best panoramic views in Joshua Tree National Park. It's a steep climb, gaining about 1,000 feet in elevation, but the wide-open desert views from the summit are worth the effort. You'll see everything from boulder piles to distant mountain ranges.
